title: Previous email data
creator: adilishaqacca
content:
Hi everyone,

I could really use some help with Mozilla Thunderbird.

I had my official email set up in Thunderbird using a POP3 connection. Before I updated Windows and reinstalled Thunderbird, I backed everything up — all the emails and settings.

Now, after reinstalling Thunderbird, I’m trying to get my old emails and account settings back, but I just can’t seem to make it work. I tried copying my old profile folder over the new one, but nothing shows up properly.

I’m not sure if I’m doing something wrong or missing a step. Can someone please walk me through how to properly restore a POP3 email backup in Thunderbird? I really need to get my old emails back.

Thanks a lot in advance!

title: Email doesnt get deleted from source on move
creator: smithktrevor
content:
I'm having a bit of an issue with moving emails between my accounts in Thunderbird, and I'm hoping someone can shed some light on what I'm doing wrong.

When I move an email from one account (let's call it the source) to another (the destination), it seems to only move it locally on my computer. The email appears in the destination folder, but it never actually gets deleted from the source account's server.

If I click on the inbox of the source account again, Thunderbird just re-syncs with the server and downloads the same email all over again. In my mind, when I "move" something, it should be gone from the original location. It feels more like a "copy and then forget to delete" situation.

I'm trying to figure out how to make the "move" action permanent. I want the email to be completely removed from the source account when I move it, not just hidden on my local client until the next sync.

Is there a setting I'm missing, or is this just how Thunderbird handles moving emails between accounts? It's making it a real headache to keep my inboxes organized.

Thanks in advance for any help!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Copy and paste within Address Book
creator: IrvT
content:
Some years ago I found it very useful to create group address books within my overall Address Book. However, when I created a new one last week, after first entering two new-to-me contacts into it, I could not find any way to copy other contacts from my general list into the new group. IOW, in order to add OldFriend1. OldFriend2, etc to NewGroup, it seemed that while inside NewGroup I would have to type each of them in, one by one, as if brand new. Right-clicking on OldFriend brought up a menu that offered Edit and Delete, but *not* Copy, let alone "Add to Group." Can it really be true that there's no easy way to simply *add* OldFriend1, etc, to NewGroup without having to create duplicate entries? Thank you!

(Using 115.11.0, 64-bit edition, in the Windows 10 Pro environment.)
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/keyboard-shortcuts-thunderbird"]

title: Issue with Microsoft Teams Add-on in Thunderbird when Using Multiple Exchange Accounts
creator: crt26
content:
Hi there, I'm experiencing an issue with the Microsoft Teams add-on in Thunderbird, specifically when using it with multiple Microsoft Exchange accounts.

Issue Description:

Previously, I was able to select between accounts using the Teams icon in the toolbar without any problems. However, after switching operating systems, the behavior has changed:

  • When I hover over the Teams icon in the toolbar, the account selection menu appears as expected.
  • As soon as I move the mouse to select an account from the menu, the menu disappears immediately before I can click anything.
  • I've made sure that the mouse doesn't leave the icon or jump erratically, but the menu still vanishes every time.

This only started happening after I changed my OS. On my previous setup, the add-on worked fine.

Fixes Attempted:

  • Removed and re-added the Exchange Accounts
  • Reinstalled the Owl for Exchange add-on
  • Fully uninstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird, including manually deleting the profile data folder
  • Disabled hardware acceleration

So far, nothing has resolved the issue, and I haven’t found any other reports of this specific behavior online.

The attached image shows the account selection menu when hovering over the teams add-on, but as soon as the mouse moves over to the menu it disappears.

System and Application Details:

  • Thunderbird Version: 139.0.1 (64-bit)
  • Operating System: Kubuntu 25.04
  • Desktop Environment: KDE Plasma 6.3.4
  • Display Manager: X11
  • Kernel Version: 6.14.0-15-generic (64-bit)

Any suggestions or workarounds would be greatly appreciated.
metadata: ;solver_id:181052;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird ist extrem langsam – start dauert auf flammneuen Rechner über 5 Minuten
creator: sofni75
content:
Guten Tag, ich arbeite mit Thunderbird auf Linux Mint. Jeweils in den aktuellsten Versionen: Linux Mint 22.1 Cinnamon Thunderbird 128.11.0esr (64-Bit)

Auf meinem bisherigen Rechner begann Thunderbird mit dem letzten Upgrade von Linux Mint langsamer zu laufen. Da ich mir nicht anders zu helfen wusste, habe ich in einen neuen Computer investiert. Obwohl der Rechner jetzt deutlich performanter sein sollte, hängt Thunderbird mindestens genauso wie vorher. Zum Teil ruft Thunderbird auf dem neuen Rechner auch keine neuen E-Mails mehr ab. Ein Neustart korrigiert das zwar wieder, aber beim nächsten Start kann es dann wieder genauso sein.

Alles, was man in den Foren findet, um Thunderbird schneller zu machen, habe ich erledigt. Cache gelöscht, im abgesicherten Modus gestartet (da ist Thunderbird genauso langsam). Auch verschieben von Nachrichten in Archivordner brachte keine wirkliche Besserung.

Ich nutze Thunderbird für 7 Kalender (zum Teil lokal) und 10 E-Mail-Adressen bei unterschiedlichen Anbietern.

Als Add-on habe ich DKIM Verifyer installiert und aktiv.

Ehrlich gesagt, bin ich inzwischen ziemlich verzweifelt, was das Thema angeht. Witzigerweise lassen sich die Entwicklerwerkzeuge nicht aufrufen. Keine Ahnung, ob das vielleicht ein Indiz für den Fehler sein könnte.

Hat jemand eine Idee? Oder noch Fragen?

Herzlichen Dank.
metadata: ;solver_id:6788044;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0;kb_visits_prior:["/de/kb/erstellen-einer-thunderbird-laufzeitanalyse"]

title: IMAP Sync Clarification
creator: skdajnfgsdgew
content:
Mozilla's documentation on IMAP Synchronization Mozilla's documentation on IMAP Synchronization indicates

"Non-synchronized messages are still accessible within Thunderbird. The only difference is that rather than downloading the entire message, only the message "headers" are downloaded. (Message headers contain information like the sender, recipient(s), subject, etc - everything except the body of the message.) The message body is not downloaded until you click on the message in the message list"

Under what settings (e.g. Sync messages checked or unchecked) does this behavior apply?

Thanks.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Searching using the exact word(s)
creator: hi62
content:
The Thunderbird search feature use some kind of fuzzy search, but I would like to be able to search for the exact word I typed.

One example is if I look for "assurance", Thunderbird will show results for "assurer", "assurent" in addition to "assurance", but I would like only the email with the exact word "assurance" to be returned (sorry, my last search was using a French term, but you get the gist of my question even if you don't speak French). I tried putting the word between double quotes or adding a + sign in front of the word, it doesn't work.

Any option I didn't see that would let me do this or is it a feature request I'm asking here? I didn't find anything in the documentation, nor any add-on that would be helpful. Even when I’m sorting the results by relevance, with the number of emails I have, it's not as helpful than finding the exact word(s) I'm searching, which is what I want most of the time.
